description: Exclusionary squares: numbers n such that digits of n are not present in n^2.
comments: Complement of A189056; A076493(a(n)) = 0. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 16 2011A258682(a(n)) = a(n)^2. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jun 07 2015
references: Clifford A. Pickover, A Passion for Mathematics, Wiley, 2005; see p. 60.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
prog: (Haskell)a029783 n = a029783_list !! (n-1)a029783_list = filter (\x -> a258682 x == x ^ 2) [1..]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jun 07 2015, Apr 16 2011
crossrefs: Cf. A059930 = numbers n such that n and n^2 combined use different digits, A112736 = numbers whose squares are exclusionary.
author: _Patrick De Geest_
